title: Builder (United States Navy)
text:
Builder (abbreviated as BU) is a <a href="United%20States%20Navy">United States Navy</a> occupational <a href="Naval%20rating">rating</a>. A builder is responsible for the <a href="construction">construction</a> and repair of <a href="wood">wood</a>, <a href="concrete">concrete</a>, and <a href="masonry">masonry</a> structures. Their work can involve <a href="sheet%20rock">sheet rock</a>, <a href="Ceramic">ceramic tile</a>, or <a href="painting">painting</a>, while senior personnel deal with material estimates and labor projections. Builders also conduct the Navy's combat and disaster preparedness operations. 
The builder's rating badge shows two traditional tools for construction - the <a href="Steel%20square">carpenter's square</a> and the <a href="plumb-bob">plumb-bob</a>.
At the <a href="senior%20chief%20petty%20officer">senior chief petty officer</a> level, the builder rating merges with the <a href="engineering%20aide">engineering aide</a> and <a href="Steelworker%20%28US%20Navy%29">steelworker</a> ratings. At this level, they are referred to as a senior chief constructionman (abbreviated as CUCS).
At the <a href="master%20chief%20petty%20officer">master chief petty officer</a> level, they merge with all other construction ratings as a master chief seabee (abbreviated as CBCM).
